meanings.definition: The act of filling or fulfilling something.
meanings.sent1: Her impletions of joy were evident in her wide smile.
meanings.sent2: The impletions of the cup with water were quick and efficient.
meanings.sent3: His impletions of snacks always made him the favorite at picnics.
meanings.sent4: The impletions of love in her heart overflowed to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The impletions of colors in the painting created a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The state of being filled or fulfilled.
meanings.sent1: The impletions of satisfaction were clear on his face.
meanings.sent2: The impletions of the room with furniture made it cozy.
meanings.sent3: The impletions of the jar with cookies made it irresistible to passersby.
meanings.sent4: The impletions of happiness in her life were contagious to all.
meanings.sent5: The impletions of knowledge in his mind expanded with each book he read.
